alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 11:10PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following counties, Columbia and Richmond. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Fort Gordon, Martinez, Augusta, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, South Augusta, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Summerville, Glendale, Augusta National Golf Club, Midtown, Augusta Regional Airport, Glenn Hills, Forest Hills, Westwick, Hillcrest Memorial Park and Windy Ridge Estates. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 188 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
